Description: Mould-made pottery lamp decorated on the discus with Isis Pelagia or Pharia, with a sail-like veil. The shoulder is plain, except for two small studs near the heart-shaped nozzle. At the rear is a ring handle. The slightly raised base is defined by a groove; at its centre is an impressed dot. The nozzle is damaged. Covered with a buff slip.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q2028.bis)
